param.name: SHADE
param.dialogReference:
Analytical Hillshading

Grid (output)

The angle between the surface and the incoming light beams, measured in radians.

param.name: METHOD
param.dialogReference:
Shading Method

Choice

Available Choices:

[0] Standard

[1] Standard (max. 90Degree)

[2] Combined Shading

[3] Ray Tracing

[4] Ambient Occlusion

Default: 0

param.name: AZIMUTH
param.dialogReference:
Azimuth [Degree]

Floating point

Default: 315.000000

Direction of the light source, measured in degree clockwise from the north direction.

param.name: DECLINATION
param.dialogReference:
Height [Degree]

Floating point

Default: 45.000000

Height of the light source, measured in degree above the horizon.

param.name: EXAGGERATION
param.dialogReference:
Exaggeration

Floating point

Default: 4.000000

The terrain exaggeration factor allows to increase the shading contrasts in flat areas.

param.name: SHADOW
param.dialogReference:
Shadow

Choice

Available Choices:

[0] slim

[1] fat

Default: 1

Choose 'slim' to trace grid node's shadow, 'fat' to trace the whole cell's shadow. The first is slightly faster but might show some artifacts.

param.name: NDIRS
param.dialogReference:
Number of Directions

Integer

Minimum: 2

Default: 8

Number of sample directions for ambient occlusion. Divides azimuth range (270 to 0 to 90 degree) into sectors. Declination (0 to 90 degree) is divided in (Number of Directions / 4) sectors.

param.name: RADIUS
param.dialogReference:
Search Radius

Floating point

Minimum: 0.001000

Default: 10.000000

Radius used to trace for shadows (ambient occlusion) [map units].
